Facsimile Images

((ivy-leaf)) Θ(εοῖς) ((ivy-leaf)) Κ(αταχθονίοις) ((ivy-leaf))
Οὐρβᾶνα ἔζησ(εν) ἔτη
((·)) δ´ ((·)) μῆν(ας) ((·)) ς´ ((·)) ἡμέρ(ας) ((·)) ιη´
Οὐρβικὸς ((·)) καὶ Ν̣ίκη
5γονεῖς ((·)) τέκνῳ γλυ-
κυτάτῳ ((#interpunct)) ἐποίησαν

Apparatus criticus

Text based on photograph; Kaibel: Οὐρβᾶνα; Korhonen: Οὐρβανά
lines.5-6: lapis: seemingly γλυ|κυτάτο but misleading modern overpainting

English translation

To the underworld deities. Ourbana lived for 4 years, 6 months and 18 days. Ourbikos and Nike, her parents, made (this) for their sweetest child.

Italian translation

Alle divinità infere. Ourbana visse 4 anni, 6 mesi e 18 giorni. Ourbikos e Nike, i genitori, realizzarono (questo) per la loro dolcissima figlia.

commentary

The epitaph has the traditional structure with the invocation to the underworld deities, the mention of the deceased and her age. In an independent sentence are the names of the dedicants, the name of the deceased in dative and the dedication verb. In this epitaph, the degree of kinship of the dedicators towards the deceased is also specified (γονεῖς) and the affective expression τέκνῳ γλυκυτάτῳ. The parents are also named in IG 14.1981 = ISic003252, an epitaph for Ourbana’s mother, Roskia Nike (the Nike of this epitaph) perhaps coming from the same monument and thus later than this epitaph. For the name Οὐρβᾶνα/Urbana, see also CIL 10.7347 = ISic000053.

bibliography

  • 14.1919 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072
  • 140 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028
  • IGUR 865
